main_definition: To seize or take hold of something suddenly and forcefully.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To quickly and eagerly obtain or acquire something.
meanings_and_examples.example: She grabbed the last piece of cake before anyone else could.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To seize or take hold of something suddenly, often with force.
meanings_and_examples.example: He had to grab the rope tightly as he was pulled towards the waterfall.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To pick up or collect items quickly and without much thought.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the storm, they grabbed whatever food remained in their pantry.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used informally to express surprise or interest when something unexpected happens.
meanings_and_examples.example: Did you hear about that new movie coming out? Grab it! It sounds amazing!

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take a photograph quickly and without much preparation.
meanings_and_examples.example: I'll grab some photos of the sunset while we wait for dinner.
